elements.2211.03285_43fe653d0b5abad39898d878106c0: Mutation-based fuzzing has become one of the most common vulnerability discovery solutions over the last decade
elements.2211.03285_b5ec25effef7f2c6072f986921e1e: Fuzzing can be optimized when targeting specific programs, and given that, some studies have employed online optimization methods to do it automatically, i.e., tuning fuzzers for any given program in a program-agnostic manner
elements.2211.03285_c712acf1b239268eadde6ea18df19: However, previous studies have neither fully explored mutation schemes suitable for online optimization methods, nor online optimization methods suitable for mutation schemes
elements.2211.03285_dad00803ed93bc0e40c23d8e414ad: In this study, we propose an optimization framework called
elements.2211.03285_67632c38576e2f6b55f34a8909867: is that it can generally be incorporated into existing fuzzers, such as AFL and Honggfuzz
elements.2211.03285_9b855bc403666b789dbede77c8bf8: As a proof of concept, we implemented
elements.2211.03285_74d4c8eb000423b10e805331c1b72: into AFL++ and showed that the program-agnostic optimization delivered by
elements.2211.03285_f5840f8e694eaf35b4f18956f9cf9: -AFL++ to achieve higher code coverage than AFL++ in all of ten real-world FuzzBench programs
elements.2211.03285_20d8a1b29dfc40d375ffb1159d6e7: -AFL++ against several real-world programs from OSS-Fuzz and successfully identified three previously unknown vulnerabilities, even though these programs have been fuzzed by AFL++ for a considerable number of CPU days on OSS-Fuzz.
elements.2211.03285_b0a53bc0fdb04a5a1dc950a1edcdb: Fuzzing is one of the most effective and widely-used methods for identifying vulnerabilities
elements.2211.03285_7895fb1f2e702c3cc3711f8edccfd: Given a targeted program under test (PUT), the goal of fuzzing is to find inputs that cause abnormal termination of the program
elements.2211.03285_22039c16b85958a6ee0735c81b32c: To address this problem, fuzzers iteratively mutate a given set of test cases or generate random byte sequences with a given grammar to obtain new inputs and execute the program with those inputs
elements.2211.03285_fc36e3686bc289fbbb5703842d652: Despite the simplicity of its mechanism, fuzzing has discovered a large number of bugs and vulnerabilities and has contributed considerably to improving the quality and security of software
elements.2211.03285_c4ee46b2a41c54e26fe68d0dacd8a: Fuzzing can be customized for specific types of PUT to maximize its effectiveness
elements.2211.03285_d46470e3b8971e62eeb5bf6224ce1: For example, extensive research has been conducted on the design of fuzzers targeting file formats with a fixed syntax, such as XML, and software with semantics, such as JavaScript engines and database management systems
elements.2211.03285_0d134df83899e3ee84a3680390590: To be more general, fuzzers can be optimized if users have a clear scope of programs to fuzz and can devote engineering efforts to make them reflect the characteristics of the targeted programs, as in structure-aware
elements.2211.03285_805db0b70f0c06e1ed876f47a39c2: On the other hand, fuzzers have already been used to ensure software quality and security in an unspecified large number of software development projects, as seen in OSS-Fuzz
elements.2211.03285_44bb6d2615bf7ee0c2ca6ca2b7c0a: In most cases, fuzzers are considered just one of the automated services used during development, and it is possible that developers cannot afford the cost of customizing and effectively using fuzzers
elements.2211.03285_e21e4459a9f272fcceb9a69a3f080: This suggests that it is desirable to automatically tune fuzzers by considering the characteristics of the provided programs to maximize their effectiveness without requiring additional engineering efforts
elements.2211.03285_658f3c2409b7ccc8e5aad160394a5: To meet this demand, online optimization algorithms, particularly bandit algorithms, have gained attention in recent years as a means of accelerating the efficiency of mutation-based fuzzing
elements.2211.03285_495d694b7db3b3b47e489dda85766: \cite{ScheduleBlackBox, EcoFuzz, SyzVegas, AdaptiveFuzzTS, CMFuzz, HierarSeed, SIVO, HavocMAB}
elements.2211.03285_7941c165880ca4de5fd25a05bc21e: They are expected to work with a minimum amount of information that can be retrieved in any environment as long as feedback-driven fuzzing can be used
elements.2211.03285_1af18412c53900027a172579490ed: For example, mutation-based fuzzing generates new input by randomly making several choices, including the choice of seeds to be mutated and the mutation method
elements.2211.03285_e5fd3f5b6544f83f6cbd34053dc1f: By treating these choices as bandit problems, fuzzers have successfully found more execution paths, and thus, bugs
elements.2211.03285_c64e3e50ab7cfa095142afa39c30b: , a new optimization framework that uses bandit algorithms to optimize two particular choices in mutation-based fuzzing: the method of mutation and the number of mutations to be performed on a seed at once
elements.2211.03285_42b88e1294fc631d46c470a02acfa: This allows fuzzers to distinguish which method and number of mutations are more likely to discover new execution paths at runtime without any prior knowledge
elements.2211.03285_70cffc24abc42183c05f012c9ad76: To take full advantage of bandit algorithms, we made the following three key observations upon incorporating them.
elements.2211.03285_611a67f702a71bf4b7ea29b218426: We introduce a new mutation scheme that is, so to speak,
elements.2211.03285_1a5f4212172c376be9aab7098b852: so that the two choices in mutation can be easily and directly treated as bandit problems
elements.2211.03285_35fc311337ac66caf65d8d93e2379: Whereas the typical mutation scheme used in existing fuzzers applies multiple types of mutation operators at a time, our scheme uses exactly one type of mutation operator per mutation, considering that only one arm can be selected per step in a bandit problem
elements.2211.03285_3442233f6685684f9f4860411db94: We experimentally show that a fuzzer achieves similar code coverage regardless of whether it follows the conventional scheme or our bandit-friendly scheme, which allows the modification of existing fuzzers so that they follow the bandit-friendly scheme
elements.2211.03285_9f29a1ca2ff5161b776958b07efbf: This mutation scheme resolves the dependency of existing methods on heuristics that were introduced to harness online optimization without changing the mutation scheme
elements.2211.03285_87ea73e8d52a552d103c10c8455d7: Although these heuristics work well in practice, it is also beneficial to adhere to vanilla optimization algorithms by changing the scheme itself; this enables us to take advantage of the theoretical guarantees and advancements in the well-researched field of optimization algorithms
elements.2211.03285_012a01db754c7055de38d4a6adc28: For example, it enables the direct incorporation of unseen algorithms to be proposed in the near future into fuzzing.
elements.2211.03285_33ef10ac44e7ebefc10ae3e94246e: Our optimization target includes not only the mutation operators but also the number of times mutations are applied to one seed at a time, referred to hereafter as
elements.2211.03285_04f18f1c401fc3934317873c0a1ec: We acknowledge that this target had been already employed in the existing method
elements.2211.03285_03bb8ffc00fb2ee68c458d17beaa1: This was based on the observation that a fuzzer showed different performances with batch size set to different fixed values
elements.2211.03285_e1a7351c2e0c911a31a373cdf7fb0: However, we focus on this from another observation and perspective, which consequently differentiates
elements.2211.03285_118e66c4f1e3870158af6f0d3f878: Specifically, we found that the optimal batch size can vary depending on the length of the seed to be mutated; therefore,
elements.2211.03285_ec8f93536ac55d44823b05be0772b: considers the lengths of seeds when optimizing the batch size.
elements.2211.03285_d6f7fc25b8b060391f773a0b5b7ca: We further conducted a comprehensive comparison of bandit algorithms and determined the most suitable one for our framework
elements.2211.03285_22cbfdf236ea4e63425e2833508fb: Although there are various types of bandit algorithms, the extent to which each type of algorithm works effectively with fuzzing has not been investigated in detail, possibly because the aforementioned heuristics have hindered the adoption of various algorithms
elements.2211.03285_f7607c3f8fef25bb2d33e2ed4dc85: Hence, we ran a thorough experiment to compare classical, non-stationary, and adversarial bandit algorithms by incorporating them into a fuzzer and measuring their performance
elements.2211.03285_73196b9807455c7717fd8da5756d0: We then found that the fuzzers with adversarial bandit algorithms performed worse than those with other algorithms in our mutation scheme
elements.2211.03285_53ae627ebe6fcaefe55275ad277da: With these key observations, as a proof of concept, we implemented
elements.2211.03285_4fba6ed518fa0cf775ed3bef67402: and measured its performance extensively on two benchmarks: FuzzBench
elements.2211.03285_d9c1e715741cd67beaf179f081c82: -AFL++ achieved a higher code coverage than its baseline, AFL++, proving that it realizes PUT-agnostic optimization
elements.2211.03285_d7bb22bc50d6efec54fbe1da848cb: We also compared the performance improvement achieved by

elements.2211.03285_72e1d6c030fa22a42557aa7bcc2ae: outperformed the others on average in the tested PUTs and that each optimization method provided various levels of improvement for different PUTs, which indicates the future potential of our approach by combining with them
elements.2211.03285_c6cce7b996e6ef70eef91da513e1a: -AFL++ against several PUTs in OSS-Fuzz for seven days to determine whether it could find crashes and vulnerabilities in real-world programs
elements.2211.03285_a23cc0b82a050eade79b3ede159bc: -AFL++ found 17 unique bugs, three of which were confirmed as previously undiscovered vulnerabilities and assigned CVE IDs
elements.2211.03285_aa16696e4ed091bae55ac45147e0f: Given a target program (program under test; PUT) and a set of initial test cases for the program, mutation-based fuzzers run in a semi-permanent loop, generating inputs and feeding them to the program
elements.2211.03285_f34d9fc979bdeb2e6d0ce0ca39082: In particular, in each iteration of the loop, the fuzzers perform the following steps.
elements.2211.03285_862e23e7434d0091d6fb59a374675: First, the fuzzers choose a source test case to generate a new input and the number of inputs to be generated
elements.2211.03285_4806cf4f8003c640680f21fee8006: In fuzzing, the test cases are called seeds because the chosen test case works as a sample of the new inputs, and the policy of selecting seeds is called
elements.2211.03285_0d12f41ca69a14b95d841bf17fa8f: Common seed-scheduling methods include selecting seeds from a seed queue in order or at random.
elements.2211.03285_c6092ee87f6ea17d86689e80bd705: The fuzzers then modify the chosen seed the determined number of times to create a new input
elements.2211.03285_d2fc8de827565e979690088081a5f: In many cases, modifications made to the seed are selected from a predetermined set of operations, such as bit flipping or insertion of a constant byte sequence
elements.2211.03285_ecd2e2bd0c8311d68adc2a9c79fdb: Usually, fuzzers also decide which position in the input to apply the mutation operator and the other arguments required by the mutation operator.
elements.2211.03285_859629e862202b98246c3743ce0e9: After generating an input, the fuzzers execute the PUT and obtain feedback as a result
elements.2211.03285_3e7ddc7b8c1a4e7a9d21d5d38008b: In greybox fuzzing, for example, they can acquire code coverage, by performing lightweight instrumentation on the PUT
elements.2211.03285_41d7dc7154ad6bb095850b5a7f7ad: If they find the new input valuable through feedback, they save it as a seed
elements.2211.03285_6adbecd8f7626a278aade7e3c40ae: When the fuzzers employ dynamic optimizations in their scheduling or mutation, they then update the components based on feedback
elements.2211.03285_b157d230012173cd68f6a24998835: Thus, mutation-based fuzzers have many choices to make in their fuzzing process, which affect the efficiency of the fuzzers.
elements.2211.03285_94d088570074ff78510f8623bee3f: The multi-armed bandit problem is analogous to playing slot machines, whose goal is to find the most profitable arm (choice) from a fixed set of multiple arms and keep pulling (selecting) it as many times as possible
elements.2211.03285_a17cbee280a9b775c7c92ea39910c: Formally, a decision maker is given
elements.2211.03285_b0c15fb92408e42a36a398734275c: probability distributions over real numbers, and in each round, the decision maker chooses one of the distributions and is rewarded with a real number sampled from that distribution
elements.2211.03285_e9b693aa9547b84443fb429620641: The goal is to maximize the sum of rewards obtained as much as possible over
elements.2211.03285_dceb6990b04c0980b27b89967e263: rounds, without knowing the parameters of the
elements.2211.03285_6acd5953d97906b9a45c1119355ac: Despite the simplicity of its problem formulation, there are many variations; in the most basic variation (i.e., a regular stochastic bandit problem), the
elements.2211.03285_530c5295de7cb012d7fc1ff054745: probability distributions are defined as independent Bernoulli distributions
elements.2211.03285_9e41638202a89ffe896e45760453a: However, they can be substituted by other distributions such as normal distributions in other settings
elements.2211.03285_4df634dd1328d36fd6d1dcfb6f734: The non-stationary stochastic bandit problem assumes the probability distributions of the rewards to change with time
elements.2211.03285_5fe8b5a67fe312c2f10dfb5caef1c: The adversarial bandit problem assumes the most extreme situation, where the rewards given by the arms in
elements.2211.03285_8ac6e3bc9fa66d959b77aa78cf1c8: rounds are arbitrary and not assumed to follow any probability distribution
elements.2211.03285_950f51400db36a09c6f58c49f282d: In the study of the application of bandit algorithms to fuzzing, rewards are often assumed to take only the discrete value of
elements.2211.03285_33d34265ce52736fa0f8531ffdc44: This is because the plausible rewards settable in fuzzing are whether a new crash, code block, or execution path is found by executing a PUT
elements.2211.03285_c2c483e85386ea27fe221cf56a38d: Our study is no exception: we use the discovery of execution paths as a reward
elements.2211.03285_24b065b5701ed351a410649dbd267: Note that our proposed method is valid even if the reward is replaced by the discovery of crashes or code blocks.
elements.2211.03285_43bb3faf8e6cf5775d639244c7f78: Various components of mutation-based fuzzers have been refined from different perspectives to improve their efficiency, that is, increase code coverage, particularly after the advent of the representative feedback-driven fuzzer AFL
elements.2211.03285_9bd2d0836d450225201ee21fd3afd: Some studies achieved efficiency purely by speeding up the execution of PUTs and the acquisition of feedback from that execution
elements.2211.03285_55418108e8fcb6988747b5913a138: Other studies aimed to generate inputs that are more likely to find new code blocks by supplying extra information into feedback with binary instrumentation, taint inference, or emulators, and/or by integrating other techniques to solve constraints such as the SMT solver
elements.2211.03285_9755e36ec3abb927e43be8b15e228: \cite{VUzzer, REDQUEEN, Eclipser, Angora, KLEE, Driller, QSym}
elements.2211.03285_d7a4428eb6e31569431b4295d0bcb: However, these technologies often have non-negligible additional costs to deploy; they usually reduce the execution speed of PUTs and thus lower the throughput of a fuzzer
elements.2211.03285_537d8c742353805f2ec39244218d3: They may also support a limited range of program execution environments, narrowing the range of PUTs that can be fuzzed
elements.2211.03285_622e20a8b5221315225bb0459b0d7: Because of this concern, a series of studies have explored optimizations to make existing feedback-based fuzzers work efficiently against any PUTs without additional information
elements.2211.03285_998843069dc9f68b5bee8f7b84418: Most studies focused on either seed selection or mutation because they are essential parts of mutation-based fuzzers, which simply repeat the loop of selecting a seed, modifying it to create new inputs, and executing a PUT with them
elements.2211.03285_ab382d7890f3049778f201665bb32: For example, AFLFast optimized a parameter called
elements.2211.03285_7426c026e6cab74509cd054eea042: , which denotes the number of times a seed is used to generate new inputs by modeling fuzzing as a Markov chain
elements.2211.03285_887bc99b3f584a565b91c694f07fa: and Patil and Kanade adopted reinforcement learning
elements.2211.03285_92fed726e5a032b408a21e266b112: In another direction, Rebert et al.
elements.2211.03285_71b44e0845b9321070b83579d1dff: optimized seeds to be kept in a seed set as a minimal set cover problem
elements.2211.03285_1624d57539d11934acc2b0b7172e6: FairFuzz introduced a mutation mask to limit the positions in the input to be modified, thereby increasing the likelihood that new inputs will trigger rare execution paths
elements.2211.03285_e0f434492978605ad3733a594c5c7: Our study has the same motivation as these studies to achieve PUT-agnostic optimization; however, we focus on applying bandit algorithms because they can be further leveraged by introducing our bandit-friendly scheme.

elements.2211.03285_cc3693c2d37902421ab6e0ee14ec5: Given a seed, mutation-based fuzzers modify it by applying mutations several times
elements.2211.03285_a491565724cce4bce22dbb4d402e6: In the case of AFL, the number of mutations applied to a seed is determined by
elements.2211.03285_d1905a4f40a07d2b8128efa10eb8b: suggested that optimizing the batch exponent for each PUT could accelerate fuzzers
elements.2211.03285_54b2b0855828aa9a7a2c35711412b: We also focus on the batch size but our idea is different in that when we optimize the batch size, we consider not only the difference of PUTs but also the size of the seed to be mutated and the mutation method to be applied.
elements.2211.03285_3a051f63b6717009b3c8e944c8e17: First, we hypothesize that the best batch size is dependent on the seed size
elements.2211.03285_466165fd92882ff2b288a57c1e431: To validate this hypothesis, we collected seeds saved during fuzzing campaigns with AFL++
elements.2211.03285_58703b6df765b87e7b10a5dfa043a: , grouped them by the sizes of their parent seeds, and analyzed how many times mutations were applied to produce them
elements.2211.03285_23649bb9e46baa76c946e9c136208: We executed AFL++ 30 times against PUTs taken from FuzzBench for 24h, and the results are summarized in Figure
elements.2211.03285_3fb5a9aaaa5147158be786928c8e4: Even though AFL++ chooses batch sizes randomly
elements.2211.03285_930f44532fb6cee702b444c67e2c6: , the distributions of effective batch sizes are different, depending on seed sizes even in the same PUT
elements.2211.03285_5377b101c083fd0e4f37408f7a62d: This implies that, rather than assigning the same probability to all batch sizes without considering seed sizes, we should weight them appropriately based on the sizes to find a new execution path efficiently
elements.2211.03285_13caf101ff9361d2ee1402cb1b76c: Hence, we prepare different bandit problem instances for different seed sizes
elements.2211.03285_e8e2da04665011de82d03e9c583f1: As a side note, it is interesting that, in half of the PUTs, as the seed size increases, the ratio of batch size
elements.2211.03285_4d4b8aa850bb6e4b42d5d7447107d: decreases, which indicates that the possibility of triggering a new execution path with
elements.2211.03285_e9bf87f8f68ce2ea33b4f8a59d668: times of mutations decreases as the seed to be mutated becomes larger
elements.2211.03285_227f7c37bde689c2ba9e7b744af24: This phenomenon may be interpreted from the perspective of
elements.2211.03285_7a90acc6da4fe3c21fe5902fca8dc: ; the bigger the number of mutation operators applied in parallel gets, the more efficient the random mutation becomes
elements.2211.03285_2c5ce717b7b7b2f8b14d81f4209c4: On the other hand, mutating too many positions of a seed can easily break the whole structure of the seed by destroying its important parts (e.g., magic number)
elements.2211.03285_5b2a470e069e12f28f280025eb7bd: Larger seed size progressively lowers such possibility by relatively decreasing the probability of the important parts being selected as mutated positions
elements.2211.03285_ae6cc1fd101c9017445fb60b86959: However, this is just a possible explanation and this phenomenon requires further investigation, considering that it is not applicable to the other half of the PUTs
elements.2211.03285_8be323ac6daf114ce0920b088f70f: In addition, when optimizing the batch size, we should be aware of the differences in mutation operators selected
elements.2211.03285_36ae659c02cc6140b0adcd20bf9dc: Various mutation operators have been developed to find new code blocks efficiently
elements.2211.03285_8b0f7a2db61a398fc8102d6cd08c3: For example, AFL-based fuzzers contain the mutation operators named `flip
elements.2211.03285_a653481f1a8a45980f4364464a8c7: bytes'; the former only modifies one byte of the original seed while the latter appends a possibly great number of bytes to it
elements.2211.03285_6b631b3b0ee04072487cc8d97c16f: To precisely control the number of positions to be modified, we should prepare different bandit problem instances for each mutation operator
elements.2211.03285_0d325921586b0efb75a556f2d39ca: Based on these viewpoints, we designed
elements.2211.03285_f13ac95e83136741984e1346b52bc: to determine the batch exponent using the following mechanism: instead of using one fixed batch exponent or a random number, we introduce our bandit algorithm suitable for fuzzing, as explained in Section
elements.2211.03285_14c0227e29d57c837ae723168c124: , to optimize the batch exponent for each PUT
elements.2211.03285_7da979d74d49fe3323463a56373f3: We prepared different bandit problem instances for different seed sizes and mutation operators
elements.2211.03285_78c509b99fd0f8d8f074adbe72410: Because the seed sizes can be arbitrary non-negative numbers and are too many to prepare different bandit instances for each of them, we prepare five groups for seeds with sizes of
elements.2211.03285_0d84022f8a06dee7f8317d20bc015: Even though there is room for tuning, our observations indicated that these groups work well for capturing the overall tendency of seed sizes
elements.2211.03285_e7e12a92dcafb0bb2d5f29351ea99: Because a batch exponent in the original AFL++ can only be at most seven, we prepare seven bandit arms for each instance; the
elements.2211.03285_88e446fbd9fe73823dd71c4c568de: -th arm corresponds to the batch exponent
elements.2211.03285_86a8a0575758d0eb586c071594eb0: Given a source seed to be mutated and a mutation operator to be applied to the seed,
elements.2211.03285_efc52c964c3e905acb2c017b31bef: fetches the bandit instance corresponding to the seed size and the mutation operator
elements.2211.03285_e5931ff8612070f65805e747c18f9: Then, it pulls an arm of the bandit instance to obtain the batch exponent
elements.2211.03285_c115c63dc3c4ca4a73b11cae09218: After that, it mutates the seed
elements.2211.03285_8526559d89a37705ba75906f23cfb: times and tests if the execution with the mutated seed discovers a new execution path
elements.2211.03285_5025d41ef8298d6e23804c75c1088: If so, it gives a reward to the arm.
elements.2211.03285_303cbba08a8cc578c7afe1de8be45: Although our scheme is designed to accommodate bandit algorithms naturally, not all bandit algorithms may yield the same level of performance improvement
elements.2211.03285_5ddccc22ef9cac29fbc82f1a66ed5: As previous studies have highlighted, if fuzzing is viewed as a bandit problem and reward is defined as the discovery of a new execution path or crash, the rewards obtained will decrease with time because the discovery can only be made a finite number of times
elements.2211.03285_5ec7f716bdaca7e537fe6b5a1f2ca: As a result, the estimates of the expected rewards become poor
elements.2211.03285_880e144209efc5631f59d61ae7514: This can lead to worse performance in some bandit algorithms, such as UCB1
elements.2211.03285_4568c133fdb900e4f01877e352dfa: , because they rely on accurate estimates of the expected rewards to select a promising arm an appropriate number of times; the poor estimates themselves may deteriorate the algorithm performance even if the best arm is still correctly inferred
elements.2211.03285_39a343abe833ddb59bcbb05efe4fc: Thus, these previous studies employed bandit algorithms that tolerate changes in expected rewards, such as adversarial or non-stationary bandit algorithms.

elements.2211.03285_076440b040e6c96f863b08815e2a4: Among the stationary bandit algorithms, TS provided the best performance improvement on average, whereas UCB1 performed relatively poorly
elements.2211.03285_cdadb1de6dfa676de30f83a93072f: Among the non-stationary bandit algorithms, dTS and ADS-TS, which are based on TS, showed a higher performance than dBE and achieved the highest average rank; on the other hand, both adversarial bandit algorithms exhibited noticeably poor performance
elements.2211.03285_1601094b832b062670f0913a672ad: These results are consistent with previous numerical experiments on stochastic bandit problems
elements.2211.03285_fbfafd940e1a0e0e15d78e6452675: , which indicates that our mutation scheme can be characterized more as a stochastic bandit problem than an adversarial bandit problem
elements.2211.03285_e10128fa5ebd28800de79d0a744cf: Moreover, the non-stationarity of fuzzing as a bandit problem cannot be confirmed in this experiment, as the TS, dTS, and ADS-TS algorithms produced comparable results
elements.2211.03285_3693a39437cceb91d75fb66079d38: However, this cannot completely disprove the non-stationarity because TS sometimes gives a strong performance even in non-stationary bandit problems, for example, when the best arm is unchanged
elements.2211.03285_ba5b6e4f0070d2e972101088c76a4: We must note that, as shown in Table
elements.2211.03285_47fac59f74dc110b2466c8063e48f: , this stochastic tendency can be observed
elements.2211.03285_e8021448c2e5f5e069a81b50f5b4d: PUT, and also that there may be different tendencies for different mutation schemes
elements.2211.03285_592e656f58ac73015e4f33306b8a7: Nevertheless, it is likely that fuzzers with bandit optimization can improve their performance by regarding their algorithm as a type of bandit problem and appropriately employing bandit algorithms in that class
elements.2211.03285_0fcef14dde3bcdfc63a1e8972429e: Based on this result, we have adopted TS as the standard algorithm for
elements.2211.03285_1ca2aa8350e02ebbbfc11fb9bf965: -AFL++ for further experiments because it achieved the highest median coverage.
elements.2211.03285_379a69384368e1b1874b8a2cba49d: To demonstrate that our algorithm based on the above observations contributes to the realization of PUT-agnostic online optimization and compare it with existing methods, we evaluated TS-
elements.2211.03285_40d5ec7a1b4ec613258a2ebeaa5e7: -AFL++ on major coverage-based and bug-based benchmarks: FuzzBench
elements.2211.03285_fd43119661fa97f6a416f667d897a: MAGMA is a ground-truth fuzzing benchmark in real-world software; bugs are inserted artificially and each crash triggered by a fuzzer can be identified.
elements.2211.03285_620375c5b801b94b49f35fe54054d: All experiments, including our initial exploration in Section
elements.2211.03285_347d86b6aa4e83c8d0e3849751628: , were conducted on an NVIDIA DGX A100 640GB workstation with two AMD EPYC 7742 2.25GHz CPUs with 256 logical cores in total
elements.2211.03285_1ec3397fcceb7b93139614608e8f5: To avoid fuzzer instances that interfere with each other and produce inaccurate results, we ran only the instances of a single fuzzer in parallel

elements.2211.03285_e122f1bf3e676e3aa044cef52c7dc: Preliminary experiments confirmed that the number of PUT executions per second was not significantly affected even when 110 instances were running simultaneously.
elements.2211.03285_539d0b891f335fb7554ffa70a5f0c: , AFL++ combined with the algorithm proposed by Karamcheti et al. (hereafter referred to as Karamcheti-AFL++)

elements.2211.03285_d7e3647540942a6c4b5f5fd9a3256: lists the average number of bugs triggered by the six fuzzers
elements.2211.03285_1a305237081efecdc9fa26e5d510f: -, and SLOPT-AFL++ ranked higher than AFL++ when compared by average ranks and scores, which is consistent with those metrics in Table
elements.2211.03285_6c32f1f96180ba5bf3798e627222e: At the same time, however, the difference between the fuzzers was overall ambiguous compared to code coverage
elements.2211.03285_d1f99f586fc50c06aa5110432bc0c: Also, we could not see any statistical significance except between MOpt-AFL++ and AFL++ in one PUT
elements.2211.03285_e19eb5664f79a595f7e81f0476084: However, we see this result reasonable, considering that these optimization methods all treat the discovery of a new execution path as a reward and aim at increasing code coverage, not bugs found
elements.2211.03285_801085fb832fb6cd70755cd45ee99: In fact, it has recently been recognized that code coverage and the number of bugs found do not have a proportional relationship
elements.2211.03285_700327f377419ebbb0552024afdbd: Nevertheless, it is worth mentioning that
elements.2211.03285_4a7f792a0f8e51d217b74c506836a: did not cause a noticeable deterioration although it creates a new input always with a single mutation operator, and on the contrary, it found more unique bugs than AFL++ in entirety, as shown in
elements.2211.03285_e7b4ee02bc4dec670bf2e6b827981: In addition to the evaluations in Section
elements.2211.03285_95693e27c65fd852e9b934b6138e2: -AFL++ on large real-world programs for a longer period of time
elements.2211.03285_381d8633a05553b2c1ad4f4369b1d: The purpose of this trial is to see if employing
elements.2211.03285_a6bd100b41c9b8c93eaafc2e157b3: is valuable in practice for identifying bugs, because we found in Section
elements.2211.03285_68c996d91cd40b95e067b6112e822: that improving code coverage does not immediately lead to a drastic increase in bugs detected
elements.2211.03285_1ca99001ce3b701d8157a4a55dab0: -AFL++ for 7 days on 12 PUTs (listed in Table
elements.2211.03285_caa0e585e4ce8c713d978bfffa351: ) that were manually selected from OSS-Fuzz
elements.2211.03285_3e23cffad74f6afb6c08fa1855156: The selection criteria for PUTs were that the PUT must be large in code size so that fuzzers are likely to continuously find new code blocks (thus preventing saturation) and that the project of the PUT must be active and contactable in cases where vulnerabilities are found
elements.2211.03285_c5bdaf274cbffe4343ef72f4a300c: The configuration of each PUT, including initial seeds and dictionaries, was unchanged from those used in the infrastructure of OSS-Fuzz, and the execution environment was the same as Section
elements.2211.03285_141103f2861366085b75a937f1ae4: Through manual triage, we found that
elements.2211.03285_5612c3796900cc1d2719390de0ec0: -AFL++ discovered 17 bugs, as listed in Table
elements.2211.03285_1d59648d7441748acee249ca745d3: Although we do not deny the possibility of AFL++ being able to find these bugs, we must note that AFL++ has already been fuzzing the PUTs for an enormous number of CPU days on the infrastructure of OSS-Fuzz (estimated to be more than hundreds of CPU years)
elements.2211.03285_9b9b991ea6f3f4d155a66a6168c78: , and thus the possibility is extremely low
elements.2211.03285_399fa571e122b543ab6dfa8f26d93: In fact, three of these bugs were confirmed as unseen vulnerabilities and were assigned CVE IDs
elements.2211.03285_742c107111d51003602f9231fad49: We believe this result supports the practicability of online optimization methods for code coverage in real-world software testing.
elements.2211.03285_940f09b8c915a57d832c2dd338a9b: As in any empirical study, the greatest threats to our claims lie in the correctness and generality of our experimental results, which affect the internal validity and external validity, respectively.
elements.2211.03285_546f5ad74df737b73d896babbea54: The peculiar difficulty in our experiments is that the compared fuzzers share the same understructure
elements.2211.03285_ce7cf04f9f112a62d1be7964b1159: , the fuzzers are all variations of
elements.2211.03285_f2990be9099d6c0da30699e513b64: -AFL++, with the only difference between them being the bandit algorithm employed
elements.2211.03285_3b0bd45f77f1dbfb5829292cacbf9: , the fuzzers are implemented upon AFL++; hence, the seed scheduling or mutation operators themselves are identical
elements.2211.03285_81e80a312280e8a137ef85c00444a: As we showed in these sections, these fuzzers wholly exhibited performance improvement to some extent, and consequently, it was sometimes difficult to observe evident differences in the quality of their improvement
elements.2211.03285_d17fbf4c848ee0e3e90b157dd764a: To avoid missing these small differences to the extent feasible, we tried to analyze the results of the experiments comprehensively or statistically (as recommended in
elements.2211.03285_790592647b27be1426bc70d6efd20: ) while increasing the number of instances of fuzzers and PUTs, within time and resource constraints
elements.2211.03285_caf5d8d14e47e7a294fdf240a6ba0: At the same time, we were aware that excessive use of statistical tests can cause multiple testing problems
elements.2211.03285_cd4ef4822d31b0c864af8597c2a59: , which may lead to spurious conclusions
elements.2211.03285_78589dd8ae25982b69a15cdb2e9f5: To avoid these, while finding significant differences as much as possible, we cautiously selected the differences to apply statistical tests to and corrected the resultant p-values using the Holm-Bonferroni method
elements.2211.03285_19e5bcb893c6fbd674edd8c169b89: Another threat to internal validity is the wrong implementation of fuzzers
elements.2211.03285_c80c4e90f18ab196c1de0cc9328f9: While implementing them, we referred to their original source code if it was available
elements.2211.03285_3d42aac995628a28e4059f7aac755: Moreover, for each algorithm, we set up an implementer and a reviewer to ensure that the original algorithm was reproduced.
elements.2211.03285_554b0b0db19d4732fe9e3a72b20e7: To mitigate the threat of the tested PUTs being biased, we ensured the use of various types of real-world PUTs in the evaluations in Section
elements.2211.03285_0859f6e1e7789e0b6528a59a81d4b: For this purpose, we selected PUTs from well-known benchmarks FuzzBench and MAGMA
elements.2211.03285_a3197e08694e1744c73cb14383e59: While we did not adopt all the PUTs in FuzzBench to keep the experimental cost reasonable, we randomly selected 10 PUTs, which accept a wide variety of input file formats as a result
elements.2211.03285_eebcf90ce980fa3c6eb02fd5e1fbf: Another concern regarding external validity is the baseline of the fuzzers
elements.2211.03285_4c1d778fde0df7d629e975d206e99: Through all the experiments, we consistently set AFL++ as the suitable baseline because the mutation of AFL++ now consists solely of
elements.2211.03285_0bfba2764f76bb32190309a2b8118: , and AFL++ has high performance among such fuzzers on average according to past benchmarks
elements.2211.03285_13116e9e6145858c3b62c9a8ab666: , which is very important for obtaining more rewards and distinguishing optimization methods
elements.2211.03285_92b1627b1c30d1526c47ccfe153e6: It is possible that the selection of different baselines leads to different conclusions
elements.2211.03285_c81b2cdd674b6475ef95879d9b139: However, we believe similar results will appear as long as the mutation scheme of a fuzzer is the same because the random mutation
elements.2211.03285_79a0758f0ea24abbf288cc982fe20: dominates the performance of the fuzzer, as studied by Wu et al.
elements.2211.03285_bcaf68c98f761bf3fd7574b2720db: One factor that we have not considered when viewing fuzzing as a bandit problem is the correlation between the arms
elements.2211.03285_12d8c68b75c4be1803e6897c52f6d: For example, in a PUT that accepts only an input consisting of ASCII printable characters, mutation operators that tend to produce non-ASCII printable characters are not considered good choices
elements.2211.03285_66ed58f3259712d57517d41bfce74: Alternatively, in a PUT that has a limit on the length of inputs to be accepted, mutations such as inserting a constant string or copying a partial byte sequence from another seed are not promising arms
elements.2211.03285_5ab5c946e46f018970b9c0576533d: While the distributions of rewards are assumed to be independent in standard stochastic bandit problems, there are studies on such problem settings where the arms are correlated, aimed at reducing regret further compared to the standard settings
elements.2211.03285_9cfd42d7b2c1920575e693c74326a: Even assuming independence, bandit algorithms can greatly improve the efficiency of the fuzzer
elements.2211.03285_a62e2db0fe65da0ab91d5c9af6770: Nonetheless, they suggest the possibility of further improvement by considering this correlation.
elements.2211.03285_d8ac21d652c84fb8188df1fcd5f2f: In this study, we explored a new methodology to maximize the effectiveness of bandit algorithms for optimizing the mutation of fuzzers
elements.2211.03285_589bfcda9aa36c862d432b6781fc5: We first made the three observations: (a) blending different types of mutation operators into a single mutation is not imperative; (b) batch size is suitable as an optimization target and can have different optimal values depending on seed size; (c) various bandit algorithms give different levels of performance improvement
elements.2211.03285_bb84531657b9214d2f51f4466b9d6: Based on these findings, we implemented
elements.2211.03285_a528d0d554228eef13383c6f56537: -AFL++, which successfully achieved better code coverage than AFL++ in the evaluation
elements.2211.03285_8b44f0fab60b81ba16fffb4d18dc0: Also, the performance improvement delivered by
elements.2211.03285_6f4873f9fa7d377701cae6bb2c530: Although, on the other hand, it did not significantly increase bugs found in the evaluation,
elements.2211.03285_090cf92edf165764e67e801167eec: -AFL++ found three previously unseen vulnerabilities in real-world programs from OSS-Fuzz to prove its value in bug identification
elements.2211.03285_79a3e34ad9c33722ae46eb0bb995c: We believe that our results not only provide a general improvement in the performance of existing unoptimized mutation-based fuzzers, but also provide insights to enhance the performance of other fuzzers employing bandit algorithms
elements.2211.03285_afbff8cfd322e717d9aaecbb14ef9: In addition, because our results include practical evaluations conducted with PUTs in OSS-Fuzz, we believe that
elements.2211.03285_afa06f1f33b9fd0b09af11abd837f: -AFL++ can be introduced in OSS-Fuzz with little effort
elements.2211.03285_b9649f76f32b51f8def6c62ab569a: We would like to contribute to the introduction of SLOPT-AFL++ in large-scale fuzzing efforts such as Google's OSS-Fuzz initiative.
